hints.content:
Find $20$ on the scale of the graph.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Student and the vertical axis labeled Words Found. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Fen, Gabe, Luke, Minn, and Dan. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 50. The bar line for each student shows the following: Fen’s bar line extends to the middle of 20 and 30, Gab’s bar line extends to 40, Luke’s bar line extends to the middle of 40 and 50, Minn’s bar line extends to 30, and Dan’s bar line extends to 30. A red line is drawn to the right from 20 across the graph. !

hints.content: On the scale, all bars ending above $20$ show amounts of more than $20$.
Fen, Gabe, Luke, Minn, and Dan all found more than $20$ words in their word search puzzle.

question.content:
Five students in the school's Puzzle Club had a contest to see who could find the most words in a word search puzzle.


[[☃ image 1]]

**Which of the following students found more than $20$ words in their word search puzzle?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Student and the vertical axis labeled Words Found. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Fen, Gabe, Luke, Minn, and Dan. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 50. The bar line for each student shows the following: Fen’s bar line extends to the middle of 20 and 30, Gab’s bar line extends to 40, Luke’s bar line extends to the middle of 40 and 50, Minn’s bar line extends to 30, and Dan’s bar line extends to 30. !
